fr.sorbonne_u.cps.replication.components

Class ReplicationManagerNonBlocking<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractComponent
      • fr.sorbonne_u.cps.replication.components.ReplicationManager<T>
        • fr.sorbonne_u.cps.replication.components.ReplicationManagerNonBlocking<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.ComponentI, ReplicaI<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StateBasedDispatcher

    public class ReplicationManagerNonBlocking<T>
extends ReplicationManager<T>
    The class ReplicationManagerNonBlocking introduces the possibility to call many replicas but returning the first result while letting the other (repeated) computations terminating (not possible with invokeAny, an important behaviour when using replication for fault-tolerance.

    Description

    The call mode FIRST and its implementation in the method call shows how to perform this kind of waiting. Some care is taken to partition the exceptions between the ones that result from a malfunctioning server and the ones that result from a wrong computation. The latter must be thrown to the caller but the former should trigger fault-tolerance actions which are not implemented here.

    White-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Black-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2020-03-05

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReplicationManagerNonBlocking

        protected ReplicationManagerNonBlocking(int nbThreads,
                                        java.lang.String ownInboundPortURI,
                                        SelectorI selector,
                                        ReplicationManagerNonBlocking.CallMode mode,
                                        CombinatorI<T> combinator,
                                        PortFactoryI portCreator,
                                        java.lang.String[] serverInboundPortURIs)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        creating an asynchronous replication manager.

        Description

        If the call mode is ANY, it is better to have nbThreads == serverInboundPortURIs.length i.e., the number of threads is equal to the number of servers, so that all of them have a chance to respond otherwise the "race" will be only among the first bunch of servers called with the number of available threads. If the call mode is FIRST (return the first result to come in but let the other servers execute the request), the same may apply, but not necessarily.

        If the call mode is SINGLE or ALL, the number of threads determines respectively the number of different requests or copies of a request that can be executed in parallel.

        Contract

         pre     nbThreads > 0
 pre     ownInboundPortURI != null && !ownInboundPortURI.isEmpty()
 pre     selector != null && ThreadSafe(selector)
 pre     mode != null
 pre     combinator != null && ThreadSafe(combinator)
 pre     portCreator != null
 pre     serverInboundPortURIs != null && serverInboundPortURIs.length > 0
 pre     for (String uri : serverInboundPortURIs) { serverInboundPortURIs[i] != null && !serverInboundPortURIs[i].isEmpty()}
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        nbThreads - number of threads used to execute the client calls.
        ownInboundPortURI - URI of the inbound port of this component.
        selector - a function that selects outbound ports among the available ones.
        mode - asynchronous call mode of the replication manager.
        combinator - a function that combines results from servers to give one result returned to the caller.
        portCreator - a port factory to create inbound and outbound ports.
        serverInboundPortURIs - URIs of the inbound ports of the server to connect this component.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

        If the call mode is SINGLE or ALL, the number of threads determines respectively the number of different requests or copies of a request that can be executed in parallel.

      • finishComputations

        protected void finishComputations(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorCompletionService<T> ecs,
                                  int n)
                           throws java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        finish the computations after the first has returned its result to release the semaphore only after all have finished or when an exception has been raised.

        Contract

         pre     ecs != null
 pre     ecs n >= 0
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        ecs - the executor completion service to wait for the results.
        n - the number of awaited results.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - if one of the computation has thrown such an exception.
